title: Retrieving and extracting data with ohvbd
text: ohvbd package allows retrieve data many different databases directly. Currently databases include VecTraits VecDyn projects VectorByte. Let’s imagine wanted figure particular vector species - Aedes aegypti, example - found. ’s ’d use ohvbd : Great, lovely. now… mean? can build data request? Read find …
code: ids <- search_vt("Aedes aegypti") df <- get_vt_byid(ids) %>%   extract_vt_data(     cols = c("Interactor1Genus", "Interactor1Species", "Latitude", "Longitude"),     returnunique = TRUE   ) df

title: Retrieving and extracting data with ohvbd
text: using Linux, sometimes httr2 fails communicate VectorByte servers. systems best set ohvbd use slightly less stringent identity checks calls server. need perform . users familiar tidyverse pipes (%>%), approach generally usable ohvbd well. users familiar, pipes take output one command feed forward next command first argument: rest vignette using piped-style approach. Another note begin: functions used interface VecTraits VecDyn basically , except vt vd function name. search_vt() VecTraits equivalent search_vd(). use VecTraits functions vignette, process VecDyn.
code: set_ohvbd_compat() # Find mean of a vector normally x <- c(1, 2, 3) mean(x) ## [1] 2 # Find mean of a vector using pipes c(1, 2, 3) %>% mean() ## [1] 2

title: Retrieving and extracting data with ohvbd
text: Datasets VecTraits VecDyn organised id. often good able see IDs currently available. can using get_current_x_ids() family functions. return vector valid IDs given database: functions search_x() search_x_smart() also return list IDs match query provided arguments. case let’s search VecTraits Aedes aegypti, “Asian tiger mosquito”: returns vector IDs, time corresponding dataset Aedes aegypti one searchable columns. can also find IDs interactively online using VecTraits Explorer choose.

title: Retrieving and extracting data with ohvbd
text: Now vector datasets, need actually retrieve data datasets API. can use get_x_byid() functions. case let’s get first 5 Aedes aegypti datasets: get_vt_byid() function returns list data form original httr2 responses. useful want know specifics server sent data back, usecases useful extract data dataframe.
code: aedes_responses <- get_vt_byid(aedes_ids[1:5]) aedes_responses[[1]] ## <httr2_response> ## GET https://vectorbyte.crc.nd.edu/portal/api/vectraits-dataset/97/?format=json ## Status: 200 OK ## Content-Type: application/json ## Body: In memory (26362 bytes)

title: Retrieving and extracting data with ohvbd
text: Now list responses, can extract relevant data using extract_x_data() functions. dataset bit large print , often may want columns data rather whole dataset. Fortunately cols argument allows us filter data easily. can also use returnunique argument instruct ohvbd return unique rows. let’s get just unique locations trait name combinations data using command :
code: aedes_data <- aedes_responses %>% extract_vt_data() paste0("Data dimensions: ", ncol(aedes_data), " cols x ", nrow(aedes_data), " rows") ## [1] "Data dimensions: 157 cols x 21 rows" aedes_data_filtered <- aedes_responses %>%   extract_vt_data(     cols = c("LocationText", "OriginalTraitName"),     returnunique = TRUE   ) aedes_data_filtered ##        OriginalTraitName ## 1              body size ## 2        blood meal size ## 3              longevity ## 4          blood feeding ## 5 transmission potential

title: Retrieving and extracting data with ohvbd
text: cases may end downloading lot data. can cause problems enough memory computer store data memory , even just want one two columns, like , One potential method mitigating use get_extract_x_byid_chunked() functions. download records time extract moving next chunk ids. can perform filtered extraction like :
code: get_extract_vt_byid_chunked(   aedes_ids[1:5],   chunksize = 2,   cols = c("LocationText", "OriginalTraitName"),   returnunique = TRUE ) ##        OriginalTraitName ## 1              body size ## 2        blood meal size ## 3              longevity ## 4          blood feeding ## 5 transmission potential

title: Retrieving and extracting data with ohvbd
text: day--day use, mostly find using functions together create small pipelines. typical pipeline likely contain two lines code:
code: ids <- search_vt("Aedes aegypti") df <- get_vt_byid(ids[1:5]) %>%   extract_vt_data(     cols = c("Interactor1Genus", "Interactor1Species", "Latitude", "Longitude"),     returnunique = TRUE   ) df ##   Interactor1Genus Interactor1Species  Latitude Longitude ## 1            Aedes            aegypti  3.120833 101.65639 ## 2            Aedes            aegypti 16.250000 -61.58333

title: Retrieving and extracting data with ohvbd
text: now data might need analysis, now ’s ! One final note end : can advisable save output data csv parquet format need re-download every time run script. easy running write.csv() dataframe, reading later read.csv()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Francis Windram. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Windram F (2024). ohvbd: One Health VBD Hub. R package version 0.3.0, https://fwimp.github.io/ohvbd/, https://github.com/fwimp/ohvbd.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ohvbd: One Health VBD Hub},   author = {Francis Windram},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.0, https://fwimp.github.io/ohvbd/},   url = {https://github.com/fwimp/ohvbd}, }

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: ohvbd R package retrieving (parsing) data network disease vector data sources. present package much early stages, internal API may change without warning.

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: ohvbd allows searching retrieval data following data sources: VecTraits VecDyn AreaData

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: can install development version ohvbd GitHub :

title: One Health VBD Hub
text: *_basereq() calls longer required first argument functions. , data downloads longer need start vb_basereq() %>%. Basereq can now overridden providing alternative basereq basereq argument functions, can generated using vb_basereq(). usually needed using argument unsafe = TRUE vb_basereq(). also possible set ohvbd use compatability-mode ssl calls using set_ohvbd_compat(). change breaks code written prior version, major rewrites may required. See NEWS.md patch notes previous versions.

what: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
text: Extract data returned call get_ad(), filter columns interest dates interest. Currently handle Population Density Forecast matrices, however 5 metrics handled natively.

title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
code: extract_ad_data(   ad_matrix,   targetdate = NA,   enddate = NA,   places = NA,   gid = NA )

title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
text: ad_matrix matrix data AREAdata. targetdate ONE following: date search ISO 8601 (e.g. "2020", "2021-09", "2022-09-21"). start date range dates. character vector fully specified dates search (.e. "yyyy-mm-dd") enddate (exclusive) end range dates search . unfilled, targetdate searched . places character vector single string describing locality search dataset. gid spatial scale AREAdata matrix (needed matrix supplied get_ad()).

title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
text: matrix containing extracted data.

title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
text: function attempts intelligently infer place selections based upon provided gid place names. AREAdata dataset gid=1, provide country names, function attempt match country names retrieve GID1-level data present. Occasionally (case "Albania", municipality La Guajira, Columbia) name place may occur locations expected researcher. Unfortunately easy problem mitigate, worthwhile checking output function make sure expect.

title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
text: date range partially open interval. say lower bound (targetdate) inclusive, upper bound (enddate) exclusive. example date range "2020-08-04" - "2020-08-12" return 7 days 4th 11th August, 12th.

title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
text: cases full date provided, earliest date possible available data chosen. "2020-04" internally become "2020-04-01" incomplete date specified targetdate enddate specified, range search inferred minimum temporal scale provided targetdate. example "2020-04" taken mean month April 2020, enddate internally set "2020-05-01".

title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
text: Francis Windram

title: Extract data from AREAdata datasets — extract_ad_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # All dates in August 2022 get_ad("temp", gid=0) %>%   extract_ad_data(     targetdate = "2022-08",     places = c("Albania", "Thailand")   )  # 4th, 5th, and 6th of August 2022 (remember the enddate is EXCLUSIVE) get_ad("temp", gid=0) %>%   extract_ad_data(     targetdate = "2022-08-04", enddate="2022-08-07",     places = c("Albania", "Thailand")   )  # 4th of August 2022 and 1st of August 2023 get_ad("temp", gid=0) %>%   extract_ad_data(     targetdate = c("2022-08-04", "2023-08-01"),     places = c("Albania", "Thailand")   ) } # }

Get AREAdata dataset — get_ad
text: Retrieve AREAdata dataset/s specified metric spatial scale (GID).

title: Get AREAdata dataset — get_ad
code: get_ad(   metric = "temp",   gid = 0,   use_cache = FALSE,   cache_location = ".adcache",   refresh_cache = FALSE,   basereq = NA )

title: Get AREAdata dataset — get_ad
text: metric metric retrieve areadata. gid spatial scale retrieve (0 = country-level, 1=province-level). use_cache load files cache possible, save present. cache_location path cache location (defaults ./.adcache). refresh_cache force refresh relevant cached data. basereq url AREAdata database (usually generated ad_basereq()). NA, uses default.

title: Get AREAdata dataset — get_ad
text: matrix requested data (added attributes gid metric).

title: Get AREAdata dataset — get_ad
text: following metrics valid (alternative names listed brackets): temp (temperature) spechumid (specific humidity) relhumid (relative humidity) uv (ultraviolet) precip (precipitation, rainfall) popdens (population density, population) forecast (future climate, future)

title: Get AREAdata dataset — get_ad
text: Francis Windram

title: Get AREAdata dataset — get_ad

title: write data from AREAdata to cache file — write_ad_cache
text: d data write path cache path metric metric downloaded (inferred provided) gid gid data (inferred provided) format format store data (currenly unused) compression_type type compression use caching compression_level level compression use caching

title: ohvbd 0.3.0
text: *_basereq() calls longer required first argument functions. , data downloads longer need start vb_basereq() %>%. Basereq can now overridden providing alternative basereq basereq argument functions, can generated using vb_basereq(). usually needed using argument unsafe = TRUE vb_basereq(). also possible set ohvbd use compatability-mode ssl calls using set_ohvbd_compat(). change breaks code written prior version, major rewrites may required.

title: ohvbd 0.2.5
text: extract_ad_data() now allows targetdate specified vector full dates, e.g. c("2023-08-04", "2023-09-21").

title: ohvbd 0.2.4
text: VecTraits & VecDyn search functions longer return stale responses search fails.

title: ohvbd 0.2.3
text: VecTraits functions now use cli package provide nicer cli interface. VecDyn functions now use cli package provide nicer cli interface.

title: ohvbd 0.2.2
text: AREAdata functions now use cli package provide nicer cli interface. retrieving-data vignette now builds significantly quicker.

title: ohvbd 0.2.1
text: get_ad() now caches data AREAdata reduce extraneous data downloading speed re-execution development. requires new argument use_cache=TRUE caches default directory ./.adcache.

title: ohvbd 0.2.0
text: Install instructions now include correct command building vignettes installing GitHub. New check_db_status() allows easy checking online status various data providers. ohvbd now interfaces AREAdata repository historical climate data. includes functions get filter AREAdata datasets different spatial scales.

title: ohvbd 0.1.4
text: Small framing change retrieving-data vignette (courtesy @willpearse).

title: ohvbd 0.1.3
text: New retrieving-data vignette explain basic process downloading extracting data Vectraits VecDyn.

title: ohvbd 0.1.2
text: New search_vd() search_vd_smart() now allow searching VecDyn manner VecTraits.

title: ohvbd 0.1.1
text: get_vb_basereq() renamed vb_basereq() ease writing.

title: ohvbd 0.1.0
text: Chunked retrieval now correctly uses chunksize argument. ohvbd now interfaces VecDyn database vector population dynamic data. includes functions get ids, get datasets, extract data responses. functions use api structure VecTraits data download, vd replacing vt function names (e.g. get_vd_byid())

title: ohvbd 0.0.5
text: New search_vt() allows keyword-based searching VecTraits. get_current_vt_ids() now handles 404 responses gracefully.

title: ohvbd 0.0.4
text: New search_vt_smart() allows field-based searching VecTraits.

title: ohvbd 0.0.3
text: get_vt_byid() now leverages httr2::req_perform_sequential() efficient dataset retrieval.

title: ohvbd 0.0.2
text: Add documentation current functions.

title: ohvbd 0.0.1
text: Initial commit.
